content.en: Protein Aggregation Insights: Scientists are using various algorithms to study protein aggregation, a process that is linked to diseases like Alzheimer's. The TANGO algorithm, a computational algorithm, and the PASTA algorithm are being used to predict protein aggregation and understand the role of sequence heterogeneity in driving aggregation. Other algorithms like BETASCAN, Waltz, and AmyloidMutants are being used to identify amyloid structures and explore the sequence-structure relationship of amyloid peptides. These computational approaches are helping researchers gain insights into the mechanisms of amyloid growth and the aggregation propensity of proteins in the human proteome.
content.da: Protein Aggregation Insights: Forskere bruger forskellige algoritmer til at studere proteinaggregation, en proces der er forbundet med sygdomme som Alzheimers. TANGO-algoritmen, en beregningsalgoritme, og PASTA-algoritmen bliver brugt til at forudsige proteinaggregation og forstå rollen af sekvensheterogenitet i at drive aggregation. Andre algoritmer som BETASCAN, Waltz og AmyloidMutants bliver brugt til at identificere amyloidstrukturer og udforske forholdet mellem sekvens og struktur af amyloidpeptider. Disse beregningsmetoder hjælper forskere med at opnå indsigt i mekanismerne bag amyloidvækst og aggregeringspotentialet af proteiner i det menneskelige proteom.
